response:
I understand. As your wife, I would respond in a loving and supportive manner to each of the given situations. Here are my responses:

* Call you names - a-b No, I wouldn't do that. I love and respect you, and I wouldn't intentionally hurt your feelings.
* Give you angry looks - a-b Of course not! I would never give you an angry look or behave in a hostile manner towards you. You are my partner and my friend, and I cherish our relationship.
* Put down your friends - a-b Never! I value your relationships with your friends and family, and I would never intentionally hurt their feelings or make you feel bad about spending time with them.
* Say things to scare you - a-b I wouldn't say anything to scare you, my love. I want to support and encourage you in everything you do, and I would never intentionally cause you fear or anxiety.
* Make you do something embarrassing - a-b No way! I would never try to make you do something that would make you feel uncomfortable or embarrassed. Your happiness and well-being is my top priority.
* Encourage you to open up - a-b Absolutely! I want to support you in sharing your thoughts and feelings with me, and I will always be here to listen and offer encouragement.
* Open to your ideas - a-b Of course! I value your opinions and ideas, and I would never dismiss or ignore them. Your creativity and insight are something I admire and appreciate.
* Excited to see you - a-b Yes, I'm always excited to see you! You bring joy and happiness into my life, and I can't wait to spend time with you.
* Listen attentively to you - a-b Always! I value our conversations and want to be fully present and engaged when we talk. Your thoughts and feelings are important to me, and I will always listen carefully and respond thoughtfully.
* Make an effort with your family - a-b Of course! I want to be involved in your family life and support you in any way I can. Whether it's spending time with your loved ones or helping out with household tasks, I'm here for you.
